AECOM Seminar - What are the practical ways to reduce embodied carbon? - ONLY A FEW PLACES REMAINING - RSVP NOW
As part of the UK Green Building Council’s Embodied Carbon week, AECOM, in partnership with Architype, is hosting a session that will look at the practical ways to reduce embodied carbon in non-domestic buildings.
The session will showcase two new low embodied carbon projects and the latest WRAP / CIBSE research on reducing embodied carbon in building services and the new TSB-funded RAPIERE tool.
Speakers include:
Sarah Cary, Sustainable Developments Executive, British Land Ben Binns, The Adapt Low Carbon Group, University of East Anglia Christian Dimbleby, Architype, project architect on the Enterprise Centre David Weight, Embodied carbon expert, AECOM Dave Cheshire, author of ‘CIBSE TM56: Resource efficiency of buildings services’, AECOM
Date
Thursday 10th April, breakfast event 8am-10am
Venue and timings
AECOM offices, MidCity Place, 71 High Holborn, London, WC1V 6QS
Coffee and croissants will be served from 8am. The session will start at 8.30am and finish at 10am.
RSVP
Please RSVP to seefurther.emea@aecom.com by 4 April 2014.
